info.title: Meraki Integrated API for Secure Connect
info.description:
The Cisco Meraki Integrated API for Secure Connect is a modern REST API based on the OpenAPI specification.
  ---

  [API Documentation](https://meraki.io/api)

  [Meraki Homepage](https://www.meraki.com)

get.description:
List all activities (dns/proxy/firewall/intrusion) within the timeframe.
**Note:** The IP activity report is not available.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Organization ID associated with this resource.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
A timestamp or relative time string (for example: '-1days').
Filter for data that appears after this time.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description:
A timestamp or relative time string (for example: 'now').
Filter for data that appears before this time.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: A number that represents an index in the collection.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to return from the collection.

parameters.name: domains
parameters.description: A domain name or comma-delimited list of domain name.

parameters.name: urls
parameters.description: A URL or comma-delimited list of URL.

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: A category ID or comma-delimited list of category ID.

parameters.name: policycategories
parameters.description:
A category ID or comma-delimited list of category ID.
Filter the request by the categories that trigger a policy.

parameters.name: ip
parameters.description: An IP address

parameters.name: ports
parameters.description: A port number or comma-delimited list of port number.

parameters.name: identityids
parameters.description: An identity ID or comma-delimited list of identity ID.

parameters.name: identitytypes
parameters.description: An identity type or comma-delimited list of identity type.

parameters.name: applicationid
parameters.description: An application ID.

parameters.name: verdict
parameters.description: A verdict string or comma-delimited list of verdict string.

parameters.name: ruleid
parameters.description: A firewall policy rule ID.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description:
A string that identifies a filename. Filter the request by the filename.
Supports globbing or use of the wildcard character ('*'). The asterisk (*) matches
zero or more occurrences of any character.

parameters.name: securityoverridden
parameters.description: Specify whether to filter on requests that override security.

parameters.name: bundleid
parameters.description: A proxy bundle ID.

parameters.name: threats
parameters.description: A threat name or comma-delimited list of threat name.

parameters.name: threattypes
parameters.description: A threat type or comma-delimited list of threat type.

parameters.name: ampdisposition
parameters.description: An AMP disposition string or a comma-delimited list of AMP disposition string.

parameters.name: antivirusthreats
parameters.description: A threat name or comma-delimited list of threat name.

parameters.name: x-traffic-type
parameters.description:
A string or comma-delimited list of string that describes the type of traffic. Valid values are:
dns, proxy, firewall, or ip. If the header is not set, the default value is 'all'.

parameters.name: isolatedstate
parameters.description:
A string that describes the remote browser isolation
(RBI) isolation type (for example: 'isolated' or 'not-isolated').

parameters.name: isolatedFileAction
parameters.description:
A string that describes the remote browser isolation (RBI) file action type
(for example: 'viewed', 'downloaded-original-file', or 'downloaded-safe-pdf').

parameters.name: datalosspreventionstate
parameters.description:
A string that describes the status of a destination (for example: 'blocked').
Filter data for requests that were blocked to protect data.

parameters.name: filternoisydomains
parameters.description: filter out domains that generate a lot of insignificant traffic (noise).

parameters.name: httperrors
parameters.description:
Filter data for requests that resulted in a TLS error or a certificate error.
Valid values: `certificateerror` or `tlserror`.

parameters.name: exists
parameters.description:
Specify a comma-separated list of attributes to filter the data. Valid values are: categories, policycategories, applicationid,
nbarapplicationid, nbarapplicationtypeids, privateapplicationid, applicationgroupids, sha256, filename, threats, threattypes,
antivirusthreats, destinationlistids, httperrors.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description:
Display the timestamp of the traffic events in the specified timezone.
For the timezone, provide a continent and city separated by an url-encoded forward slash ('/'), for example: timezone='ASIA%2fCALCUTTA'.

anyOf.description: The information about the DNS activity.

label.description: the human readable label of the category

type.description: the type of category

integration.description: if the category is an integration

deprecated.description: if the category is a legacy category

type.description: the type of category

integration.description: if the category is an integration

deprecated.description: if the category is a legacy category

type.description: The information about the identity including the type

id.description: The ID of the origin type for the identity

label.description: The label of the origin type for the identity

type.description: The name of the origin type for the identity

deleted.description: Indicates whether the identity was deleted or not

type.description: type of the application, NBAR or AVC
the type of threat
The type of the request. A DNS request always has the type dns.

querytype.description:
The type of DNS request that was made. For more information,
see Common DNS Request Types.

date.description: The date from the timestamp based on the timezone parameter

time.description: The time in 24 hour format based on the timezone parameter

returncode.description:
The DNS return code for this request.
For more information, see Common DNS return codes for any
DNS service (and Umbrella).

type.description: type of the application, NBAR or AVC
type of the application, NBAR or AVC

anyOf.description: The information about the firewall activity.

time.description: The time in 24 hour format based on the timezone parameter

type.description: The information about the identity including the type

id.description: The ID of the origin type for the identity

type.description: The type of the request. A firewall request always has type firewall.

items.description: The information about the applications managed by the firewall

applicationprotocols.description: A list of firewall application protocols.

items.description: The information about the applications managed by the firewall

direction.description: The direction of the packet. It is destined either towards the internet or to the customer's network.

packetsize.description: The size of the packet that Umbrella CDFW received.

anyOf.description: The information about the intrusion activity.

classification.description: The category of attack detected by a rule that is part of a more general type of attack class, such as trojan-activity, attempted-user, and unknown.

date.description: The date from the timestamp based on the timezone parameter

type.description: The information about the identity including the type

id.description: The ID of the origin type for the identity

label.description: The label of the origin type for the identity

type.description: The name of the origin type for the identity

deleted.description: Indicates whether the identity was deleted or not

sessionid.description: The unique identifier of a session, which is used to group the correlated events between various services.

severity.description: The severity level of the rule, such as High, Medium, Low, and Very Low.

generatorid.description: Unique id assigned to the part of the IPS that generated the event.

label.description: A brief description of the signature.

items.description: An identifier for a known security vulnerability/exposure

example.label: (cip) CIP data is non-conforming to ODVA standard

id.description: Unique id assigned to a Default or Custom Signature List.

time.description: The time in 24 hour format based on the timezone parameter

type.description: The type of the request. An intrusion request always has type intrusion.

signature.label: SERVER-OTHER JBoss Richfaces expression language injection attempt

label.description: the human readable label of the category

type.description: the type of category

integration.description: if the category is an integration

deprecated.description: if the category is a legacy category

allowedapplications.description: array of allowed applications for entry

blockedapplications.description: array of blocked applications for entry

type.description: type of the application, NBAR or AVC
type of the request. A proxy request is always of type 'proxy'.

tenantcontrols.description: if the request was part of a tenant control policy

antivirusthreats.description: The information about the antivirus threats

timebasedrule.description: whether the policy triggered a time-of-day rule

destinationlistids.description: the destination lists that the policy triggered

ruleid.description: the rule ID for the policy

rulesetid.description: the rule set ID for the policy

requestmethod.description: The HTTP request method that was made.

statuscode.description: The HTTP status code; should always be 200 or 201.

useragent.description: The browser agent that made the request.

sha256.description: The hex digest of the response content.

state.description: The state of the isolated file

fileaction.description: The action taken for the file

datalossprevention.description: The information about the Data Loss Prevention state

state.description: If the request was Blocked for DLP. Either 'blocked' or ''

securityoverridden.description: Specifies whether Umbrella has security overrides.

contenttype.description: The type of web content, typically text/html.

forwardingmethod.description: The request method (GET, POST, HEAD, etc.)

type.description: type of the error `CertificateError` or `TLSError`

code.description: the http error code

attributes.description: map of additional information about the error

type.description: the type of threat

egress.description: The information about the egress IP

type.description: Egress Type

datacenter.description: The information about the data center

id.description: Unique ID for the data center

date.description: The date from the timestamp based on the timezone parameter

time.description: The time in 24 hour format based on the timezone parameter

get.description:
List the categories that received the greatest number of requests.
Order the number of requests in descending order.

parameters.description: Organization ID associated with this resource.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
A timestamp or relative time string (for example: '-1days').
Filter for data that appears after this time.

parameters.description: The maximum number of records to return from the collection.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: A number that represents an index in the collection.

parameters.name: domains

parameters.description: A URL or comma-delimited list of URL.

parameters.name: categories

tags: Organization Requests by Timerange and Category
get.summary: Get Requests by Timerange and Category (ALL)
get.description: List the activity volume within the timeframe by category.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Organization ID associated with this resource.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
A timestamp or relative time string (for example: '-1days').
Filter for data that appears after this time.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description:
A timestamp or relative time string (for example: 'now').
Filter for data that appears before this time.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to return from the collection.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: A number that represents an index in the collection.

parameters.name: domains
parameters.description: A domain name or comma-delimited list of domain name.

parameters.name: urls
parameters.description: A URL or comma-delimited list of URL.

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: A category ID or comma-delimited list of category ID.

parameters.name: policycategories
parameters.description:
A category ID or comma-delimited list of category ID.
Filter the request by the categories that trigger a policy.

parameters.name: ip
parameters.description: An IP address

parameters.name: identityids
parameters.description: An identity ID or comma-delimited list of identity ID.

parameters.name: antivirusthreats
parameters.description: A threat name or comma-delimited list of threat name.

parameters.name: timerange
parameters.description:
A string that represents a range of time (for example: `minute`, `hour`, or `day`).
If the header is not set, the header value defaults to `hour`.

parameters.name: datalosspreventionstate
parameters.description:
A string that describes the status of a destination (for example: 'blocked').
Filter data for requests that were blocked to protect data.

parameters.name: filternoisydomains
parameters.description: filter out domains that generate a lot of insignificant traffic (noise).

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description:
Display the timestamp of the traffic events in the specified timezone.
For the timezone, provide a continent and city separated by an url-encoded forward slash ('/'), for example: timezone='ASIA%2fCALCUTTA'.

items.description: The information about the categories seen by hour

timestamp.description: The timestamp represented in milliseconds for this bucket

date.description: The date from the timestamp based on the timezone parameter

time.description: The time in 24 hour format based on the timezone parameter

items.description: The information about the category counts

label.description: the human readable label of the category

type.description: the type of category

integration.description: if the category is an integration

deprecated.description: if the category is a legacy category

requests.description: total number of requests for category

parameters.name: applicationid
parameters.description: An application ID.

parameters.name: verdict
parameters.description: A verdict string or comma-delimited list of verdict string.

parameters.name: ruleid
parameters.description: A firewall policy rule ID.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description:
A string that identifies a filename. Filter the request by the filename.
Supports globbing or use of the wildcard character ('*'). The asterisk (*) matches
zero or more occurrences of any character.

parameters.name: securityoverridden
parameters.description: Specify whether to filter on requests that override security.

parameters.name: bundleid
parameters.description: A proxy bundle ID.

parameters.name: threats
parameters.description: A threat name or comma-delimited list of threat name.

parameters.name: threattypes
parameters.description: A threat type or comma-delimited list of threat type.

parameters.name: ampdisposition
parameters.description: An AMP disposition string or a comma-delimited list of AMP disposition string.

parameters.name: antivirusthreats
parameters.description: A threat name or comma-delimited list of threat name.

parameters.name: datalosspreventionstate
parameters.description:
A string that describes the status of a destination (for example: 'blocked').
Filter data for requests that were blocked to protect data.

parameters.name: filternoisydomains
parameters.description: filter out domains that generate a lot of insignificant traffic (noise).

data.description: The summary information about the requests

applications.description: total number of applications (avc or total)

get.description: List all discovered applications.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Organization ID associated with this resource.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description:
Specify the types of log source to filter the collection.
Valid values are: `dns`, `swg`, `cdfw`.

parameters.name: identity
parameters.description: Specify the entity ID to filter the collection.

parameters.name: labels

items.description: The application label. Valid values are: `unreviewed`, `approved`, `notApproved`, `underAudit`.

parameters.description:
Specify the types of application classification to filter the collection.
Valid values are: `unreviewed`, `approved`, `notApproved`, `underAudit`.

parameters.name: controllable
parameters.description:
Specify the type of controllable applications to filter the collection.
Valid values are: `all`, `advanced`.

parameters.name: weightedRisk

items.description: The risk the app poses to the environment.

parameters.description:
Specify the list of application weighted risk to filter the collection.
Valid values are: `veryLow`, `low`, `medium`, `high`, `veryHigh`.

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: Specify the list of application category to filter the collection.

parameters.name: appTypes
parameters.description:
Specify the types of application to filter the collection.
Valid values are: `saas`, `paas`, and `iaas`.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
Specify a date to search for data within a twenty-four hour time period.
If you do not provide a date, the last 90 days period is used to query the collection.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in the collection.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Specify the name of a field to sort the applications.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Specify the order to sort the collection. Valid values are: `asc` (ascending)
or `desc` (descending).

parameters.name: label_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter the result set on the time when the label was updated.

Link.description:
Links to related resources, in the format defined by
[RFC 5988](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-5).
If there is a next page, this header includes a link with relation type
`next` to the next page.

schema.description: The object that contains the list of application properties.

items.description: The list of properties about the discovered apps.

name.description: The name of the app.

label.description: The application label. Valid values are: `unreviewed`, `approved`, `notApproved`, `underAudit`.

weightedRisk.description: The risk the app poses to the environment.

sources.description:
The list of app sources where the sources are DNS, Web (Secure Web Gateway), and cloud-delivered firewall (CDFW) traffic events.
The list can contain one or more of the source types.

anyOf.description: The properties of the app's DNS requests.

name.description: The type of traffic associated with the source.

requests.description: The number of DNS requests for this app.

blockedRequests.description: The number of DNS requests blocked by Umbrella, based on policy configurations.

anyOf.description: The properties of the app's web requests.

name.description: The type of traffic associated with the source.

totalTraffic.description: The total number of bytes inbound and outbound for this app in your environment.

blockedBytesOut.description: The number of bytes of outbound traffic that are blocked.

anyOf.description: The properties of the app's requests that are managed by the Umbrella cloud-delivered firewall (CDFW).

name.description: The type of traffic associated with the source.

events.description: The number of CDFW L7 events for this app.

blockedEvents.description: The number of CDFW L7 events that are blocked.

firstDetected.description: The date when the app was first detected.

lastDetected.description: The date when the app was last detected.

error.description: A brief description of the error

someProperty.description: the name of the property failing validation.

schema.description: Unauthorized- The authorization header is missing or the token is unauthorized

parameters.description: Organization ID associated with this resource.

model.description: The model name of the device. Must be unique to your organization.

macAddress.description:
The MAC address of the device. The unique MAC address may include
up to 12 characters and must not contain hyphens or colons.

name.description:
The name of the device. The name is a sequence of characters with a length from 1 through 50.
The name must be unique in your organization.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the device.

tag.description: A text tag that describes the device or this origin, which is assigned to the device. Provide a tag that is unique to your organization.

example.model: The model name of the device.
example.name: A name for the device.

Content-Type.description: The MIME content type of the response body.

originId.description:
The unique global identifier for this traffic source (origin). Use
the origin ID to manage the device. The origin ID is not used by the device.

deviceId.description: The unique identifier for the specific network device. Insert the identifier into the EDNS packets.

deviceKey.description:
A descriptive unique identifier for the device. Not used by the
device.

name.description: The name of the device.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the device.

createdAt.description: The time when the device was created. Specify an ISO 8601-formatted timestamp.

get.description:
List the Umbrella policies associated with a network device.
If no filters are supplied, Umbrella returns the DNS policies.

parameters.description: The origin ID of the network device.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the policy (`dns` or `web`).

Content-Type.description: The MIME content type of the response body.

schema.description: The list of policies, which are associated with the network device.

items.description: The policy that is associated with a network device.

policyId.description: The unique ID for the policy.

name.description: The name of the policy.

isAppliedDirectly.description: Specify whether the policy is directly applied to this network device.

isDefault.description: Specify whether the policy is the default policy.

createdAt.description: The time when the policy was created. Specify an ISO 8601-formatted timestamp.

get.description: List the tunnels for an organization.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Organization ID associated with this resource.

parameters.name: includeState
parameters.description: Specify whether to include the tunnel state information in the response.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of items to return in the collection. If not set, all tunnels are returned.

parameters.name: startKey
parameters.description:
Specify where to start reading in the tunnel collection (`startKey` correlates to the first tunnel to return).
If the `startKey` query parameter is not included in the API request, Umbrella reads the collection from the first available tunnel.
When the API request includes the `limit` query parameter and you have more tunnels to read,
Umbrella returns the value of `startKey` for the next tunnel in the hypermedia Link header.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
Filters the tunnel list by tunnel name, device type, service type, status, data center, or site origin ID.
For example:
```
{
  "name": "test",
  "deviceType": "ISR",
  "serviceType": "SIG",
  "status": "UP",
  "dataCenter": "pao1.edc",
  "siteOriginId": 123
}
```

Content-Type.description: The MIME content type of the response body.

Total-Item-Count.description: The total number of active, inactive, and unestablished tunnels in the organization.

Total-Distinct-DC-Count.description: The number of distinct data centers in the organization.

Total-Active-Item-Count.description: The total number of active tunnels in the organization.

Total-Inactive-Item-Count.description: The total number of inactive tunnels in the organization.

Link.description:
The hypermedia links are formatted as a string. Use to provide parameters for pagination.
Only available if request limits the number of tunnels returned.
The link is a relative path. The `rel` value is always `next` (pagination moves forward).

items.description:
Get the information about the tunnel in the organization.
To include the tunnel state information in the response, set the `includeState` request query parameter to `true`.

id.description: The tunnel resource ID. Use this ID as a reference for subsequent requests.

name.description:
The display name of the tunnel. The tunnel name is required, cannot exceed 50 characters in length,
and cannot have any special characters other than spaces and hyphens.

siteOriginId.description: Site Origin ID to associate with the tunnel

deviceType.description: The type of device where the tunnel originates. The default value is `other`.

authentication.description: The authentication context of the client.

id.description: The PSK ID. If an IP address is used as the ID, the IP address is the value of this field.

modifiedAt.description:
The date and time (timestamp) that Umbrella updated the tag on the roaming computer.
The timestamp is an ISO 8601 formatted string. For example: `2023-04-12T23:20:50.52Z`.

protocol.description: The tunnel transport protocol. The default is IPSec.

serviceType.description: The type of service to associate with the tunnel. The default value is `SIG`.

networkCIDRs.description:
Enter IPv4 ranges and CIDR addresses.
If `serviceType` is SIG, add all public and private address ranges used internally
by your organization. Overrides Umbrella's default behavior,
which allows traffic that is destined for RFC-1918 addresses to return through the tunnel.
If `serviceType` is Private Access, this field is required.
The 0.0.0.0/0 address range is not allowed.

meta.description: The metadata for the tunnel object that relates to service internals.

status.description:
The high-level tunnel status:
* up - the tunnel is active
* down - the tunnel is inactive
* failed - the tunnel is in a failed state
* unknown - the status is unknown and pending updated information

dc.description: The domain name that is associate with the data center.

dcName.description: The name of the data center.

dcDesc.description: The city and country or region of the data center.

ikeState.description:
IKE SA State:
  * CREATED
  * CONNECTING
  * ESTABLISHED
  * PASSIVE
  * REKEYING
  * REKEYED
  * DELETING
  * DESTROYING

ipsecState.description:
IPSec/Child SA State:
  * CREATED
  * ROUTED
  * INSTALLING
  * INSTALLED
  * UPDATING
  * REKEYING
  * REKEYED
  * RETRYING
  * DELETING
  * DELETED
  * DESTROYING

localIp.description: The public IP address, which is assigned to an endpoint device (ISR, Viptela).

peerPort.description: The port number of the remote peer.

age.description: The age of the established state in seconds.

initiatorSpi.description: The hex encoded initiator SPI or cookie.

responderSpi.description: The hex encoded responder SPI or cookie.

age.description: The age of the installed state in seconds.

integrityAlgo.description: The ESP or AH integrity algorithm name.

encKeySize.description: The ESP encryption key size (optional field; not available with NULL encryption.

data.title: tunnelDataState
data.description: The state of the tunnel's data plane.

packetsIn.description: The number of processed input packets (tunnel ingress).

bytesIn.description: The number of processed input bytes (tunnel ingress).

idleTimeIn.description: The idle time (seconds since last inbound packet).

packetsOut.description: The number of processed output packets (tunnel egress).

bytesOut.description: The number of processed output bytes (tunnel egress).

idleTimeOut.description: The idle time (seconds since last outbound packet).

initialized.description: The time when packet and byte counters were initialized to 0.

modifiedAt.description: The date and time (UTC time with milliseconds) when the tunnel's state was last updated.

createdAt.description: The date and n time (UTC time with milliseconds) when the tunnel was created.

modifiedAt.description:
The date and time (timestamp) that Umbrella updated the tag on the roaming computer.
The timestamp is an ISO 8601 formatted string. For example: `2023-04-12T23:20:50.52Z`.

Content-Type.description: The MIME content type of the response body.

error.description: a brief description of the error

txId.description: a unique hex number that can be used for debugging

post.description: Add a new tunnel to the organization.

name.description: The name of the tunnel.

siteOriginId.description: The site origin ID to associate with the tunnel.

deviceType.description: The type of device where the tunnel originates. The default value is `other`.

serviceType.description: The type of service to associate with the tunnel. The default value is `SIG`.

networkCIDRs.description:
Enter IPv4 ranges and CIDR addresses.
If `serviceType` is SIG, add all public and private address ranges used internally
by your organization. Overrides Umbrella's default behavior,
which allows traffic that is destined for RFC-1918 addresses to return through the tunnel.
If `serviceType` is Private Access, this field is required.
The 0.0.0.0/0 address range is not allowed.

protocol.description: The tunnel transport protocol. The default tunnel transport protocol is IPSec.

type.description: The authentication method. The default is pre-shared key (PSK).

idPrefix.description:
A human-readable ID for the tunnel, used to generate the ID portion of the Pre-Shared Key.
If omitted, the ID is generated and provided in response. Tunnels with a device type of ASA
must provide an IP address string for this field. Tunnels with a device type of 'other'
may use either an IP address or a human-readable string. PSK IDs are not automatically generated
for ASA devices.

secret.description:
The secret portion of a Pre-Shared Key (PSK).
If omitted, a secret is generated and provided in the response.
Secrets are a sequence of 16 to 64 characters, and contain at least one upper
and lowercase letter, one number, and no special characters.

Content-Type.description: The MIME content type of the response body.

schema.description: The properties of the tunnel resource object.

id.description: The tunnel resource ID. Use this ID as a reference for subsequent requests.

name.description:
Display the name of the tunnel. The tunnel name is required, cannot exceed 50 characters in length,
and can't have any special characters other than spaces and hyphens.

siteOriginId.description: The Site origin ID that is associated with the tunnel.

client.description: The tunnel client's configuration metadata including the client secret.

deviceType.description: The type of device where the tunnel originates. The default value is `other`.

authentication.description: The authentication context of the client.

id.description: The PSK ID. If an IP address is used as the ID, the IP address is the value of this field.

modifiedAt.description:
The date and time (timestamp) that Umbrella updated the tag on the roaming computer.
The timestamp is an ISO 8601 formatted string. For example: `2023-04-12T23:20:50.52Z`.

secret.description: The secret of the PSK credentials. Ensure that you save the secret. The secret is not provided at any other time.

protocol.description: The tunnel transport protocol. The default transport protocol is IPSec.

serviceType.description: The type of service to associate with the tunnel. The default value is `SIG`.

networkCIDRs.description:
Enter IPv4 ranges and CIDR addresses.
If `serviceType` is SIG, add all public and private address ranges used internally
by your organization. Overrides Umbrella's default behavior,
which allows traffic that is destined for RFC-1918 addresses to return through the tunnel.
If `serviceType` is Private Access, this field is required.
The 0.0.0.0/0 address range is not allowed.

meta.description: The metadata for the tunnel object, related to service internals.

createdAt.description: The date and time (timestamp) when the tunnel was created.

modifiedAt.description:
The date and time (timestamp) that Umbrella updated the tag on the roaming computer.
The timestamp is an ISO 8601 formatted string. For example: `2023-04-12T23:20:50.52Z`.

delete.description: Delete a tunnel in the organization.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Organization ID associated with this resource.

parameters.name: id

Conflict - Unable to delete requested tunnel as it is attached
to a policy and detachPolicies was not specified in the request.
Check the response body for policies which this tunnel is attached to.

To delete this tunnel, remove it from all policies and deployments.

parameters.description: Organization ID associated with this resource.

parameters.description: The ID of the tunnel.

parameters.description: Filter the list of policies to only include the specified type.

parameters.description: The number of items to return in the collection.

parameters.description: The number of a page in the collection. Use with the limit parameter to implement pagination.

id.description: The resource ID. Use the ID as reference for subsequent requests.

type.description: The type of policy.

name.description: The name of the policy.

priority.description: An integer that represents the position of the policy in the policy list.

isDefault.description: Indicates whether the policy is the default policy.

isAppliedDirectly.description:
True if the tunnel is applied directly to this policy, false if the policy
is configured to use all tunnels.

createdAt.description: The date and time (timestamp) when the tunnel was created.

modifiedAt.description:
The date and time (timestamp) that Umbrella updated the tag on the roaming computer.
The timestamp is an ISO 8601 formatted string. For example: `2023-04-12T23:20:50.52Z`.

id.description: The unique ID of the destination list.

access.description: The type of access for the destination list.

isGlobal.description:
Specifies whether the destination list is a global destination list.
There is only one default destination list of type `allow` or `block` for an organization.

name.description: The name of the destination list.

thirdpartyCategoryId.description: The third-party category ID of the destination list.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the destination list was created.

modifiedAt.description: The date and time when the destination list was modified.

isMspDefault.description: Specifies whether MSP is the default.

markedForDeletion.description: Specifies whether the destination list is marked for deletion.

bundleTypeId.description:
The type of the destination list in the Umbrella policy.
Set `1` for DNS, `2` for web, and `4` for SAML Bypass.
If the field is not specified, the default value is `1`.

destinationCount.description: The total number of destinations in a destination list.

domainCount.description:
The total number of domains in a destination list.
Domains are part of the total number of destinations in a destination list.

urlCount.description:
The total number of URLs in a destination list.
Urls are part of the total number of destinations in a destination list.

ipv4Count.description:
The total number of IP addresses in a destination list.
IP addresses are part of the total number of destinations in a destination list.
